abstract.p: Letter from Prof Michael H Davis questions Aug 10 Q & A regarding legality of converting songs from CD to MP3 format

block.p: As an author (with Arthur Raphael Miller) of ''Intellectual Property'' (West Information Publishing Group, 1990), I must tell you that your advice that converting songs from a CD to the MP3 format ''is legal as long as you paid for the original CD'' is misleading (''Doing It Your Way: Sorting and Copying,'' Q & A, Aug. 10). There is nothing in the law requiring the person doing the copying to have paid for the CD. All the law requires to be immune from infringement claims is that the copying be done for private purposes.
The writer is a law professor at Cleveland State University.
